title: Par 3 Golf Course | 1 of 2
question_text:
In golf, par is determined by the number of strokes a golfer without advantage (or handicap, as it is termed) is expected to take on a given hole.
The dot plots shown above are for two groups of golfers on a par $3$ course. The top dot plot is a summary of the total scores for $9\text{ holes}$ by $16$ inexperienced golfers, and the bottom dot plot is a summary of the total scores on the same course for $16$ experienced golfers.
Which of the following statements is true concerning these two distributions?

choices.text: Both distributions have similar standard deviations.
None of the statements are true.
